item.title: Introduction to OS
item.description: What is an Operating System An abstract machine Extends the basic hardware, with added functionality Hides details of the hardware Provides a high-level abstraction of the system to the developer (common framework) A resource nanager Allocates resources (CPU time, memory, etc) to users and processes (Depending on policy) Ensures no starvation occurs, and that progress is made The software running in privileged mode On microprocessors with levels of privileges (user mode / kernel mode), the OS runs in the higher privileged mode.
